text: Francis Rapp (27 June 1926 – 29 March 2020) was a French medievalist historian. His works focused in the history of Alsace and Medieval Germany. He was an Emeritus professor at University of Neuchâtel. He was a member of the Academy of Inscriptions and Fine Letters, beginning in 1993. Rapp was also a member of the editorial board of the review Archiv für Reformationsgeschichte. Rapp was born in Strasbourg, France. He died of COVID-19 on 29 March 2020 in Angers, aged 93. ==References== Category:Writers from Strasbourg Category:1926 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in France Category:French editors Category:Swiss academics Category:French historians
title: Francis Rapp
